subject: Business
title: Economies of Scale and Their Limits
description: A 60-second lesson on Economies of Scale and Their Limits.

hook.text: Making one car costs $100,000. Making a million costs $20,000 each. That's economies of scale.

buildup.text: As output grows, fixed costs spread across more units, dropping the cost per unit.

discovery.text: Walmart's scale lets it negotiate lower prices from suppliers than any small retailer can.

twist.text: Beyond a certain point, scale creates diseconomies: bureaucracy, slow decisions, and coordination costs.

climax.text: GE became so large that managing its conglomerate cost more than the scale savings it produced.

punchline.text: Scale saves money â€” until the organization becomes the expense.

quiz.question: What are diseconomies of scale?
options: Costs that rise when an organization becomes too large to manage efficiently
The initial investment required to start a factory
Lower prices caused by increased competition
